\ul\fs24 Be it enacted by the Council as follows\ulnone :\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\fs24 Section 1.  Statement of findings and purpose. The New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the \ldblquote New York State Energy Code\rdblquote ) is promulgated by the State Fire Prevention and Building Code Council pursuant to Article 11 of the New York State Energy Law.  In accordance with Article 11, the New York City Energy Conservation Code is stricter than the New York State Energy Code.  The purpose of this local law is to conform the New York City Energy Conservation Code to recent changes in the New York State Energy Code with local law amendments unique to construction in the City.\par
\fs14  \fs24\'a7 2.  Section 28-1001.1.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 4 for the year 2015, is amended to read as follows:\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\b\fs24\'a728-1001.1.1\b0  \b Definition\b0 .  As used in this chapter, the term \ldblquote New York State Energy Code\rdblquote  means the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the \ldblquote New York State Energy Code\rdblquote ), constituting part 1240 of title 19 of the New York codes, rules and regulations (19 NYCRR Part 1240), and the publications incorporated by reference in such part, promulgated on [November 18, 2014] \ul  April 6, 2016,\ulnone  by the State Fire Prevention and Building Code Council pursuant to Article 11 of the New York State Energy Law.\par
\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\fs24\'a7 3.  Section 28-1001.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York is REPEALED and a new section 28-1001.2 is added to read as follows:\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24\'a728-1001.2 New York city amendments to the New York state energy code.\b0  The following New York city amendments to the New York state energy code are hereby adopted as set forth in sections 28-1001.2.1 and 28-1001.2.2.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul\b\fs24\'a728-1001.2.1  New York city amendments to 19 NYCRR Part 1240.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 1240.6  Exceptions.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Delete Exception (b) in its entirety and replace with a new Exception (b) to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li1080\qj\ul\b\fs24 (b) Certain alterations.  \b0 The New York State Energy Code shall not apply to the following alterations of existing buildings, provided that the alteration will not increase the energy usage of the building:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 1.   Storm windows installed over existing fenestration.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 2.  Glass-only replacements in an existing sash and frame, provided that the U-factor and the solar heat gain coefficient (SHGC) shall be equal to or lower than before the glass replacement.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 3. Alterations, renovations or repairs to roof/ceiling, wall or floor cavities, including spaces between furring strips, provided that such cavities are insulated to the full existing cavity depth with insulation having a minimum nominal value of R-3.0/inch (R-2.0/cm).\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 4. Alterations, renovations or repairs to walls and floors in cases where the existing structure is without framing cavities and no new framing cavities are created.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 5.  Reroofing where neither the sheathing nor the insulation is exposed. Roofs without insulation in the cavity and where the sheathing or insulation is exposed during reroofing shall be insulated either above or below the sheathing.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\tx1890\ul\fs24 6.  Replacement of existing doors that separate conditioned space from the exterior shall not require the installation of a vestibule or revolving door, provided, however, that an existing vestibule that separates a conditioned space from the exterior shall not be removed.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\tx1800\ul\fs24 7.  An alteration that replaces less than 20 percent of the luminaires in a space, provided that such alteration does not increase the installed interior lighting power.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 8. An alteration that replaces only the bulb and ballast within the existing luminaires in a space, provided that such alteration does not increase the installed interior lighting power.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\ltrpar\cf0\fs22\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\cf1\ul\b\fs24\'a728-1001.2.2 New York city amendments to commercial and residential chapters of the New York state energy code, including amendments to the 2013 edition of Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings ("ASHRAE 90.1 -2013"), as amended by Part 2 of the 2016 Supplement.\par
\pard\ltrpar\cf0\ulnone\b0\fs22\par
\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\cf1\ul\b\fs24 Chapter 1 [CE] and Chapter 1 [RE]\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Delete Chapter R1 and Chapter C1 in their entirety and replace with a new Chapter 1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 CHAPTER 1\line ADMINISTRATION\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 INTRODUCTORY STATEMENT\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\ltrpar\cf0\fs22\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\cf1\ul\fs24 The New York City Energy Conservation Code (\ldblquote NYCECC\rdblquote ) is comprised of the New York State Energy Code (\ldblquote NYSEC\rdblquote ) with amendments as enacted into law by the New York City Council.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 The NYCECC is divided into provisions relevant to commercial buildings and provisions relevant to residential buildings as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 1.  The provisions of the NYCECC for commercial buildings are reflected in the state publications incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.4, as amended by sections 28-1001.2.1and 28-1001.2.2 of the Administrative Code of the city of New York.  Such state  publications include (i) Chapters 1 [CE], 2 [CE], 3 [CE], 4 [CE], 5 [CE] and 6 [CE] of the 2015 edition of the International Energy Conservation Code (the \ldblquote 2015 IECC\rdblquote ), as amended by Part 1 of the publication entitled the 2016 Supplement to the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the \ldblquote 2016 Energy Code Supplement\rdblquote ) (ii) the July 2014 edition of Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings (\ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2013\rdblquote ), as amended by Part 2 of the 2016 Energy Code Supplement; and (iii) reference standards incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.4(c).\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 2.  The provisions of the NYCECC for residential buildings are reflected in the state publications incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.5, as amended by sections 28-1001.2.1 and 28-1001.2.2 of the Administrative Code of the city of New York.  Such state publications include (i) Chapters 1 [RE], 2 [RE], 3 [RE], 4 [RE], 5 [RE] and 6 [RE] of the 2015 edition of the International Energy Conservation Code (the \ldblquote 2015 IECC\rdblquote ), as amended by Part 3 of the publication entitled the 2016 Supplement to the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code (the \ldblquote 2016 Energy Code Supplement\rdblquote ); and (ii) the referenced standards incorporated by reference in 19 NYCRR section 1240.5(b), as amended by Part 3 of the 2016 Energy Code Supplement.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION ECC 101\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 SCOPE AND GENERAL REQUIREMENTS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.1 General\b0 . These provisions shall be known and cited as the \ldblquote New York City Energy Conservation Code,\rdblquote  \ldblquote NYCECC\rdblquote  or \ldblquote ECC,\rdblquote  and are referred to herein as \ldblquote this code.\rdblquote  All section numbers in this code shall be deemed to be preceded by the designation \ldblquote ECC.\rdblquote  Administration and enforcement of this code shall be in accordance with Title 28 of the Administrative Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-28\qj\fs14                                           \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.1.1 Titles.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\fs24 The 2015 edition of the International Energy Code shall be known as the \ldblquote 2015 IECC.\rdblquote\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\fs24 The 2013 edition of the Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings shall be known as \ldblquote ASHRAE 90.1-2013.\rdblquote  All references in this code to ASHRAE 90.1-2013 shall be deemed to be references to ASHRAE 90.1-2013 (AS AMENDED).\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\fs24 The 2016 Energy Code Supplement to the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code shall be known as the \ldblquote 2016 Supplement.\rdblquote\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\fs24 The New York State Energy Conservation Construction  Code along with the New York City amendments to the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code shall be known collectively as the \ldblquote New York City Energy Conservation Code.\rdblquote\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs23  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.2 Scope\b0 . This code applies to commercial buildings and residential buildings, as defined in Chapter C2 and Chapter R2 of this code, and the buildings\rquote  sites, associated systems and equipment.\ulnone  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.2.1 Occupancy classifications.\b0   For determination of occupancy classification and use within this code, a comparable occupancy classification shall be made to the New York City Building Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.2.2 Reconciliation with New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code.\b0   Whenever any provision of the New York State Energy Conservation Construction Code provides for a more stringent requirement than imposed by this code, the more stringent requirement shall govern. \ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.2.3 Other laws. \b0 The provisions of this code shall not be deemed to nullify any federal, state or local law, rule or regulation relating to any matter as to which this code does not provide.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.3 Intent.\b0   This code shall regulate the design and construction of buildings for the use and conservation of energy over the life of each building.  This code is intended to provide flexibility to permit the use of innovative approaches and techniques to achieve this objective.  This code is not intended to abridge safety, health or environmental requirements contained in other applicable codes.  To the fullest extent feasible, use of modern technical methods, devices and improvements that tend to minimize consumption of energy without abridging reasonable requirements for the safety, health and security of the occupants or users of buildings shall be permitted. As far as may be practicable, the improvement of energy conservation construction practices, methods, equipment, materials and techniques shall be encouraged. \ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.4 Applicability.\b0   The provisions of this code shall apply to the construction of buildings. Where, in any specific case, different sections of this code specify different materials, methods of construction or other requirements, the most restrictive shall govern. Where there is a conflict between a general requirement and a specific requirement, the specific requirement shall govern.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.4.1 Mixed occupancy.\b0  Where a building includes both commercial and residential occupancies, each occupancy shall be separately considered and shall meet the applicable provisions of Chapters C2, C3, C4 and C5 for commercial, and Chapters R2, R3, R4, and R5 for residential.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.5 Compliance.\b0  \fs23 Commercial buildings shall comply with the provisions of this code applicable to commercial buildings in Chapters C2, C3, C4, and C5\fs24 .\fs23   Residential buildings shall comply with the provisions of this code applicable to residential buildings in Chapters R2, R3, R4, and R5.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.5.1 Compliance materials.\cf2\b0  \cf1\fs23 Compliance with the provisions of this code can be demonstrated through the use of computer software deemed acceptable by the New York State Secretary of State, and the commissioner.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.5.2 Demonstration of compliance.\b0  For a building project application or applications required to be submitted to the department, the following documentation, as further described in the rules of the department, shall be required in order to demonstrate compliance with this code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li1080\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.5.2.1 Professional\b0  \b statement.\b0  Any registered design professional or lead energy professional filing an application or applications for a new building or alteration project shall provide on a signed and sealed drawing a statement of compliance or exemption in accordance with the rules of the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li1080\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.5.2.2 Energy analysis.\b0  For any application that is not exempt from this code and for which a work permit is required in accordance with Section 28-105 of the Administrative Code, an energy analysis shall be provided on a sheet or sheets within the construction drawing set.  The energy analysis shall identify the compliance path followed, demonstrate how the design complies with this code and be in a format as prescribed in the rules of the department.  The energy analysis shall meet the requirements of this code for the entire project. Projects that utilize trade-offs among disciplines shall use DOE2-based energy modeling programs or other energy-modeling programs as prescribed in the rules of the department and shall be signed and sealed by a lead energy professional.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li1080\qj\ul\b\fs24 101.5.2.3 Supporting documentation.\b0  For any application that is not exempt from this code and for which a work permit is required in accordance with Section 28-105 of the Administrative Code, supporting documentation shall be required in the approved construction drawings.  See Section 103 for further requirements.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION ECC 102\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 ALTERNATE MATERIALS, METHOD OF CONSTRUCTION, DESIGN OR INSULATING SYSTEMS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 102.1 General. \b0 This code is not intended to prevent the use of any material, method of construction, design or insulating system not specifically prescribed herein, provided that such material, method of construction, design or insulating system has been approved by the commissioner as (1) meeting the intent of this code, (2) achieving energy savings that are equivalent to or greater than would be achieved using prescribed materials, methods of construction, designs or insulating systems, and (3) meeting the requirements of Article 113 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code and the remaining New York City Construction Codes.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION ECC 103\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 CONSTRUCTION DOCUMENTS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 103.1 General.  \b0 Construction documents shall be prepared in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code, the New York City Construction Codes, including this code, and the rules of the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 103.2 Supporting documentation on construction documents. \b0 Supporting documentation shall include those construction documents that demonstrate compliance with this code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 103.2.1  Intent. \b0  Supporting documentation shall accomplish the following:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 1.\tab Demonstrate conformance of approved drawings to the energy analysis for every element and value of the energy analysis;\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1260\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab Demonstrate conformance of approved drawings to other mandatory requirements of this code, including, but not limited to, sealing against air leakage from the building envelope and from ductwork as applicable, insulation of ducts and piping as applicable, mechanical and lighting controls with devices shown and operational narratives for each, and additional requirements as set forth in this section;\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1260\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 3.\tab Identify required progress inspections in accordance with the scope of work, this code, the Administrative Code, the New York City Building Code, and the rules of the department; and\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1260\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 4.\tab Comply with other requirements as may be set forth in the rules of the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 103.2.2 Detailed requirements.\b0   Construction documents shall be drawn to scale upon suitable material. Electronic media documents are permitted to be submitted in accordance with department procedures. Construction documents for a project shall be fully coordinated and of sufficient clarity to indicate the location, nature and extent of the work proposed, and show in sufficient detail pertinent data and features of the building, building systems and equipment as herein governed. Details shall include, but are not limited to, as applicable, insulation materials and their R-values; fenestration U-factors and SHGCs; area-weighted U-factor and SHGC calculations; mechanical system design criteria; mechanical and service water heating system and equipment, types, sizes and efficiencies; economizer description; equipment and systems controls; fan motor horsepower and controls; duct sealing, duct and pipe insulation and location; lighting fixture schedule with wattages and control narrative; location of daylight zone on floor plans (as applicable), and air sealing details.  The building\rquote s thermal envelope shall be represented on the construction documents.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 103.3 Examination of documents.\b0   In accordance with Article 104 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code, the department shall examine or cause to be examined the accompanying construction documents and shall ascertain by such examinations whether the construction indicated and described is in accordance with the requirements of this code and other pertinent laws, rules and regulations.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 103.4 Changes during construction.\b0   For changes during construction refer to Section 28-104.3 of the Administrative Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION ECC 104\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 INSPECTIONS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.1 General.  \b0 Except as otherwise specifically provided, inspections required by this code or by the department during the progress of work may be performed on behalf of the owner by an approved agency.  All inspections shall be performed at the sole cost and expense of the owner.  Refer to Article 116 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code for additional provisions relating to inspections.  In addition to any inspections otherwise required by this code or the rules of the department, the following inspections shall be required:\b  \ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 1.\tab\b Progress inspections.\b0  \b  \b0 Progress inspections shall be performed in accordance with the rules of the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab\b Final inspection.\b0  Refer to Article 116 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code and the rules of the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 3.\tab\b Issuance of Certificate of Compliance.\b0  Refer to Section 28-116.4.1 of the Administrative Code. \ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 The requirements of Section 104.1 shall not be read to prohibit the operation of any heating equipment or appliances installed to replace existing heating equipment or appliances serving an occupied portion of a structure provided that a request for inspection of such heating equipment or appliances has been filed with the department not more than 48 hours after such replacement work is completed, and before any portion of such equipment or appliances is concealed by any permanent portion of the structure. \ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.1.1 Approved agencies.\b0  Refer to Article 114 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code and the rules of the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.1.2 Inspection of prefabricated construction assemblies.\b0   Prior to the issuance of a work permit for a prefabricated construction assembly having concealed mechanical work, the department shall require the submittal of an evaluation report by the manufacturer or approved agency on each prefabricated construction assembly, indicating the complete details of the mechanical system, including a description of the system and its components, the basis upon which the system is being evaluated for energy use, test results and similar information, and other data as necessary for the commissioner to determine conformance to this code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li1080\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.1.2.1\b0\fs14  \b\fs24 Test and inspection records.\b0   Required test and inspection records shall be made available to the commissioner at all times during the fabrication of the mechanical system and the erection of the building; or such records as the commissioner designates shall be filed.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.2 Testing.\b0   Envelope, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, lighting and electrical systems shall be tested as required in this code and in accordance with Sections 104.2.1 through 104.2.3.  Except as otherwise required in this code or in the rules of the department, tests shall be made by the permit holder and witnessed by an approved agency.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.2.1 New, altered, extended, renovated or repaired systems.\b0   New envelope, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, lighting and electrical installations or  systems, and parts of existing systems that have been altered, extended, renovated or repaired, shall be tested as prescribed herein or in the rules of the department to disclose leaks and defects.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.2.2 Apparatus, instruments, material and labor for tests.\b0   Apparatus, instruments, material and labor required for testing an envelope, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, lighting and/or electrical installation or system or part thereof shall be furnished by the permit holder.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.2.3 Reinspection and testing.\b0   Where any work or installation does not pass an initial test or inspection, the necessary corrections shall be made so as to achieve compliance with the New York City Construction Codes, including this code.  The work or installation shall then be reinspected or retested by the approved agency.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.3 Sign-off of completed work.\b0   In addition to the requirements of Article 116 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code, Section 103.4 of this code and other requirements for sign-off, the project team shall either certify that construction does not differ from the last approved energy analysis or provide a whole-project as-built energy analysis and supporting documents, signed and sealed, for approval prior to sign-off.  The as-built energy analysis and supporting documents shall reflect the materials, equipment and values actually used in the construction of the project, and shall demonstrate compliance of the constructed project with this code.  Such signed and sealed documents may be accepted with less than full examination by the department based on the professional certification of the registered design professional.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 104.4 Temporary connection.\b0   The commissioner shall have the authority to allow the temporary connection of an installation to the sources of energy for the purpose of testing the installation or for use under a temporary certificate of occupancy.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION ECC 105\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 REFERENCED STANDARDS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 105.1 Referenced standards. \b0 The standards referenced in Chapters C2, C3, C4, and C5 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code shall be those that are listed in Chapter C6 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code, and in the rules of the department and such standards shall be considered part of the requirements of the commercial provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code to the prescribed extent of each such reference.  The standards referenced in Chapters  R2, R3, R4, and R5, of the New York City Energy Conservation Code shall be those that are listed in Chapter R6 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code, and in the rules of the department and such standards shall be considered part of the requirements of\ulnone  \ul the residential provisions of the New York City Energy Conservation Code\ulnone  \ul to the prescribed extent of each such reference.  Where differences occur between provisions of this code and the referenced standards, the provisions of this code shall apply. Refer to Article 103 of Chapter 1 of Title 28 of the Administrative Code for additional provisions relating to referenced standards.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C401.2.1 Application to replacement fenestration products. \b0 Where some portion or all of an existing fenestration unit is replaced with a new fenestration product, including sash and glazing, the replacement fenestration unit shall meet the applicable requirements for U-factor and SHGC in Table C402.4.\ulnone\fs27\par

\ulnone\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 C402.5.1.3 Air barrier testing.  \b0 New buildings of a certain size must comply with the following requirements:\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 New buildings 25,000 square feet (2322.6 m\super 2\nosupersub ) and greater, but less than 50,000 square feet (4645.2 m\super 2\nosupersub ), and less than or equal to 75 feet (22.86 m) in height must show compliance through testing in accordance with ASTM E 779 and department rules.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 New buildings 50,000 square feet (4645.2 m\super 2\nosupersub ) and greater, shall test or inspect each type of unique air barrier joint or seam in the building envelope for continuity and defects, as per an Air Barrier Continuity Plan developed by a registered design professional and department rules.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 3.\fs14      \fs24 Rules governing air barrier testing promulgated by the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 Section C402.5.3 Rooms containing fuel-burning appliances.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C402.5.3 - Revise Item 2 under the Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab Fireplaces and stoves complying with Sections 901 through 905 of the New York City Mechanical Code and Section 2111.13 of the New York City Building Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C402.5.4 Doors and access opening to shafts, chutes, stairways, and elevator lobbies.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C402.5.4 - Revise Item 1 and Item 2 under the Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24   \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Door openings required to comply with Section 715 or 715.3 of the New York City Building Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 Doors and door openings required to comply with UL 1784 by the New York City Building Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C402.5.7 Vestibules.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 4.\tab Doors that open directly from a space less than 3,000 square feet (278.7 m\super 2\nosupersub ) in area, in buildings less than 75 feet (22.86 m) in height, and doors that open directly from a space less than 1,000 square feet (92.9 m\super 2\nosupersub ) in area, in buildings 75 feet (22.86 m)  and greater in height.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Section C402.5.7 - Renumber Item 6 under the Exceptions as Item 7 and add a new Item 6 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 6.\tab Doors used primarily to facilitate vehicular movement or material handling and adjacent personnel doors.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 7.\tab Doors that have an air curtain with a velocity of not less than 6.56 feet per second (2 m/s) at the floor that have been tested in accordance with ANSI/AMCA 220 and installed in accordance with the manufacturer\rquote s instructions. Manual or automatic controls shall be provided that will operate the air curtain with the opening and closing of the door. Air curtains and their controls shall comply with Section C408.2.3.\ulnone\fs27\par

\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.1 Calculation of heating and cooling loads.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.1 - Revise the first sentence of Section C403.2.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Design loads associated with heating, ventilating and air conditioning of the building shall be determined in accordance with ANSI/ASHRAE/ACCA Standard 183 or by an approved equivalent computational procedure using the design parameters specified in Chapter C3.\ulnone\fs27\par

\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.4.3 Shutoff dampers.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs28  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.4.3 - Revise the second paragraph of Section C403.2.4.3 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Outdoor air intake and exhaust dampers shall be installed with automatic controls configured to close when the systems or spaces served are not in use or during unoccupied period warm-up and setback operation, unless the systems served require outdoor or exhaust air in accordance with the New York City Mechanical Code or the dampers are opened to provide intentional economizer cooling.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.6 Ventilation.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.6 - Revise Section C403.2.6 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.6\b0  \b Ventilation. \b0 Ventilation, either natural or mechanical, shall be provided in accordance with Chapter 4 of the New York City Mechanical Code. Where mechanical ventilation is provided, the system shall provide the capability to reduce the outdoor air supply to the minimum required by Chapter 4 of the New York City Mechanical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.6.1  Demand controlled ventilation.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.6.1 - Revise the first paragraph of Section C403.2.6.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Demand control ventilation (DCV) shall be provided for spaces larger than 500 square feet (46.5 m\super 2\nosupersub ) and with an average occupant load of 25 people per 1,000 square feet (93 m\super 2\nosupersub ) of floor area (as established in Table 403.3 of the New York City Mechanical Code) and served by systems with one or more of the following\ulnone :\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.6.2 Enclosed parking garage ventilation controls.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.6.2 - Revise Section C403.2.6.2 to read as follows: \ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.6.2 Enclosed parking garage ventilation controls. \b0 Enclosed parking garages used for storing or handling automobiles operating under their own power shall employ contamination-sensing devices and automatic controls configured to stage fans or modulate fan average airflow rates to 50 percent or less of design capacity, or intermittently operate fans less than 20 percent of the occupied time or as required to maintain acceptable contaminant levels in accordance with  New York City Mechanical Code provisions. Failure of contamination sensing devices shall cause the exhaust fans to operate continuously at design airflow.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b Exceptions:\par
\ulnone\b0\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 1.\tab Garages with a total exhaust capacity less than 22,500 cfm (10 620 L/s) with ventilation systems that do not utilize heating or mechanical cooling.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab Garages that have a garage area to ventilation system motor nameplate power ration that exceeds 1125 cfm/hp (710 L/s/kW) and do not utilize heating or mechanical cooling.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.7 Energy recovery ventilation systems.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.7 - Revise Item 1 under the Exception to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Where energy recovery systems are prohibited by section 514.2 of the New York City Mechanical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.7  Energy recovery ventilation systems.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 8.\tab Where the largest source of air exhausted at a single location at the building exterior is less than 75 percent of the design outdoor air flow rate.  Multiple exhaust fans or outlets located within a 30 foot (9.144 m) radius from the outdoor air supply unit shall be considered a single exhaust location.\ulnone\fs27\par

\b0\par

\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.9 Duct and plenum insulation and sealing.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par

\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ul\fs24 Joints and seams shall comply with Section 603.9 of the New York City Mechanical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\sa200\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.9.1 Duct construction.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.9.1 - Revise Section C403.2.9.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\sa200\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.9.1 Duct construction. \b0 Ductwork shall be constructed and erected in accordance with the New York City Mechanical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\sa200\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\sa200\qj\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.9.1.1 Low-pressure duct systems.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.9.1.1 - Revise Section C403.2.9.1.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\sa200\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.9.1.1 Low-pressure duct systems.\b0  Longitudinal and transverse joints, seams and connections of supply and return ducts operating at a static pressure less than or equal to 2 inches water gauge (w.g.) (498 Pa) shall be securely fastened and sealed with welds, gaskets, mastics (adhesives), mastic-plus-embedded-fabric systems or tapes installed in accordance with the manufacturer\rquote s instructions. Pressure classifications specific to the duct system shall be clearly indicated on the construction documents in accordance with the New York City Mechanical Code.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\sa200\qj\b Exception:\b0  Locking-type longitudinal joints and seams, other than the snap-lock and button-lock types, need not be sealed as specified in this section.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\sa200\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.9.1.2 Medium-pressure duct systems.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.9.1.2 - Revise Section C403.2.9.1.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\sa200\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.9.1.2 Medium-pressure duct systems. \b0 Ducts and plenums designed to operate at a static pressure greater than 2 inches water gauge (w.g.) (498 Pa) but less than 3 inches w.g. (747 Pa) shall be insulated and sealed in accordance with Section C403.2.9. Pressure classifications specific to the duct system shall be clearly indicated on the construction documents in accordance with the New York City Mechanical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \par

\ul\b\fs24 Section C403.2.18  Automatic control of HVAC in hotel/motel guest rooms.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C403.2.18 - Add a new Section C403.2.18 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.18 Automatic control of HVAC in hotel/motel guest rooms.\b0  In hotels and motels with greater than 50 guest rooms, automatic controls for the HVAC equipment serving each guest room shall be configured according to the requirements in the following subsection.  Controls must comply with either Section C403.2.18.1 or C403.2.18.2.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.18.1 Guest room HVAC setpoint control.\b0  Within 30 minutes of all occupants leaving the guest room, HVAC setpoints shall be automatically raised by at least 4\'b0F (2\'b0C) from the occupant setpoint in the cooling mode and automatically lowered by at least 4\'b0F (2\'b0C) from the occupant setpoint in the heating mode. When the guest room is unrented and unoccupied, HVAC setpoints shall be automatically reset to 80\'b0F (27\'b0C) or higher in the cooling mode and to 60\'b0F (16\'b0C) or lower in the heating mode. Unrented and unoccupied guest rooms shall be determined by either of the following:\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi1080\qj\ul\fs24 1.\tab The guest room has been continuously unoccupied for up to 16 hours.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab A networked guest room control system indicates the guest room is unrented and the guest room is unoccupied for more than 30 minutes.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi1080\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exceptions:\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 A networked guest room control system shall be permitted to return the thermostat setpoints to their default occupied setpoints 60 minutes prior to the time the room is scheduled to be occupied.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 Cooling for humidity control shall be permitted during unoccupied periods.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 C403.2.18.2 Automatic Control.\b0  Captive key card systems shall be permitted to be used to comply with Section C403.2.18.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \par

\ul\b\fs24 Sections C403.4.4.6 Multiple-zone VAV system ventilation optimization control.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\sa200\ul\fs24 Section C403.4.4.6 - Revise the first paragraph of Section C403.4.4.6 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Multiple-zone VAV systems with direct digital control of individual zone boxes reporting to a central control panel shall have automatic controls configured to reduce outdoor air intake flow below design rates in response to changes in system ventilation efficiency (Ev) as defined by the New York City Mechanical Code\ulnone .\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION C405\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 ELECTRICAL POWER AND LIGHTING SYSTEMS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 Section C405.2 Lighting Controls (Mandatory).\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Section C405.2 - Add a new sentence following the first sentence of Section C405.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Lighting controls shall be commissioned and completed in accordance with the requirements of Section C408.3.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C405.2.1 Occupant sensor controls.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C405.2.1 - Add a new Item 13 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\ul\fs24 13.\tab Open Plan Offices.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 Section C405.2.1.1 Occupant sensor control function.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C405.2.1.1 - Delete Section C405.2.1.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C405.2.1.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 C405.2.1.1 Occupant sensor control function. \b0 Occupant sensor controls in spaces other than warehouses specified in Section C405.2.1 shall comply with the following:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\fs24 1.   Automatically turn off lights within 20 minutes of all occupants leaving the space.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab Be manual on or controlled to automatically turn the lighting on to not more than 50 percent power.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-150\li1230\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exceptions:\par
\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1800\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Full automatic-on controls shall be permitted to control lighting in open plan offices, public corridors, stairways, restrooms, primary building entrance areas and lobbies, and areas where manual-on operation would endanger the safety or security of the room or building occupants.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab  \fs24 Manual on controls shall be required for classrooms (not including shop classrooms, laboratory classrooms, and preschool classrooms), conference/meeting rooms, employee lunch and break rooms, and offices smaller than 200 square feet (18.5 m\super 2\nosupersub ) in area.  Such sensors and controls shall not have an override switch that converts from manual-on to automatic-on functionality, and may have a grace period of up to 30 seconds to turn on the lighting automatically after the sensor has turned off the lighting if occupancy is detected.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi1440\qj\ul\fs24 3.\fs14       \fs24 Shall incorporate a manual control to allow occupants to turn lights off.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Figure C405.2.3.2(1) DAYLIGHT ZONE ADJACENT TO FENESTRATION IN A WALL\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par

\ul\fs24 Section C405.6.1 - Add a new Section C405.6.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C405.6.1  Measurement of electrical consumption of tenant spaces in covered buildings.  \b0 The terms meter, submeter, covered building, tenant space and covered tenant space shall be as defined in Section 28-311.2 of the Administrative Code of the city of New York.  Each covered tenant space in a new building shall be equipped with a separate meter or sub-meter to measure the electrical consumption of such space when let or sublet. Where the covered tenant space is a floor with multiple tenancies, each tenancy with an area less than that as defined in Section 28-311.2 of the Administrative Code of the city of New York shall (i) be equipped with a separate meter or sub-meter, (ii) share a meter or sub-meter with other tenant spaces on the floor, or (iii) share a meter or sub-meter covering the entire floor.  As new covered tenant spaces are created, they shall be equipped with meters or sub-meters as provided in this section.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exception:\b0  Covered tenant space for which the electrical consumption within such space is measured by a meter dedicated exclusively to that space.\ulnone\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C406.2  More efficient HVAC equipment performance.\b0   Equipment shall exceed the minimum efficiency requirements listed in Tables C403.2.3(1) through C403.2.3(7), C403.2.3(11), and C403.2.3(12) by 10 percent, in addition to the requirements of Section C403. Where multiple performance requirements are provided, the equipment shall exceed all requirements by 10 percent. Equipment not listed in Tables C403.2.3(1) through C403.2.3(7), C403.2.3(11), and C403.2.3(12) shall be limited to 10 percent of the total building system capacity.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par

\ulnone\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C407.1 Scope.\b0  This section establishes criteria for compliance using total building performance.  Buildings following the total building performance path must comply with ASHRAE 90.1-2013, demonstrating compliance under Section 11 or Appendix G of such standard.\ulnone\fs27\par

\ul\b\fs24 Section C408.1 General.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par

\ul\fs24 Section C408.1 - Delete Section C408.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C408.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C408.1  General.\b0   This section covers the commissioning of building mechanical systems in Section C403, service water heating systems in Section C404, and electrical power and lighting systems in Section C405.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C408.2  Mechanical, renewable energy, and service water heating systems commissioning and completion requirements.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C408.2 - Delete Section C408.2 in its entirely and replace with a new Section C408.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C408.2 Mechanical, renewable energy, and service water heating systems commissioning and completion requirements.\b0  Prior to passing the final mechanical and plumbing inspections, the approved agency shall provide evidence of mechanical systems commissioning and completion in accordance with the provisions of this section.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Construction document notes shall clearly indicate provisions for commissioning and completion requirements in accordance with this section and are permitted to refer to specifications for further requirements. Copies of all documentation shall be given to the owner or owner\rquote s authorized agent and made available to the code official upon request in accordance with Sections C408.2.4 and C408.2.5.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Mechanical systems, renewable energy, and service water heating systems shall include but are not limited to, at a minimum, the following heating, ventilating, air conditioning, service water heating, indoor air quality and refrigeration systems (mechanical and/or passive) and associated controls:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Heating, cooling, air handling and distribution, ventilation, and exhaust systems, and their related air quality monitoring systems.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14       \fs24 Air, water, and other energy recovery systems.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 3.\tab Manual or automatic controls, whether local or remote, on energy using systems including but not limited to temperature controls, setback sequences, and occupancy based control, including energy management functions of the building management system.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 4.\fs14\tab\fs24 Plumbing, including insulation of piping and associated valves, domestic and process water pumping, and mixing systems.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\fs24 5.\fs14       \fs24 Mechanical heating systems and service water heating systems.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\fs24 6.\fs14       \fs24 Refrigeration systems.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\fs24 7\fs14 .      \fs24 Renewable energy and energy storage systems.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 8.\tab Other systems, equipment and components that are used for heating, cooling or ventilation and that affect energy use.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exceptions:\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Mechanical and service hot water systems in buildings where the total mechanical equipment capacity being installed is less than 480,000 Btu/h (140.7 kW) cooling capacity and 600,000 Btu/h (175.8 kW) combined service water-heating and space-heating capacity.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 Renewable energy systems being installed with a generating capacity of less than 25kW.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-450\li720\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab A listing of the specific equipment, appliances or systems to be tested, their full sequences of operation, and a description of the tests to be performed, including prerequisite activities and reference to specific checklists or worksheets which are necessary or required by the department.\ulnone\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 HVAC systems shall be balanced in accordance with ASHRAE 111, \ldblquote Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing of Building HVAC Systems\rdblquote  or other accepted engineering standards as approved by the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Each supply air outlet and zone terminal device shall be equipped with means for air balancing in accordance with the requirements of Chapter 6 of the New York City Mechanical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C408.2.3.1 Equipment.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exception:\b0   Unitary or packaged HVAC equipment listed in Tables C403.2.3(1) through C403.2.3(3) that do not require supply air economizers shall only be required to demonstrate functioning under full-load and part-load conditions.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Buildings, or portions thereof, shall not be considered acceptable for a final inspection pursuant to Chapter 1 of this code until the code official has received a letter of transmittal from the building owner acknowledging that the building owner or owner\rquote s authorized agent has received the Preliminary Commissioning Report.\ulnone\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 The construction documents shall specify that the documents described in Sections C408.2.5.1 through C408.2.5.3 be provided to the building owner or owner\rquote s authorized agent within 90 days of the date of receipt of the certificate of occupancy or letter of completion.  The construction documents shall also specify that the Final commissioning report be provided to the building owner or owner\rquote s authorized agent in accordance with the requirements of  Section C408.2.5.4.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 Section C408.2.5.4  Final commissioning report.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C408.2.5.4 - Delete Section C408.2.5.4 in its entirety and replace with a new Section C408.2.5.4 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 Section C408.2.5.4 Final commissioning report.\b0   Within 30 months for new buildings 500,000 gross square feet (46 452 m\'b2) or greater, excluding R-2 occupancies, or within 18 months for R-2 occupancies and all other buildings, of the issuance of the certificate of occupancy or letter of completion, an approved agency shall prepare a report of test procedures and results, including test procedures and results performed after occupancy, identified as the "Final Commissioning Report\rdblquote , provide such report to the building owner, and submit a certification to the department with applicable fees in accordance with department rules.  The owner of a building 500,000 gross square feet (46 452 m\'b2) or greater may apply for an extension of time to the code official based on good cause, in accordance with department rules. Such report shall include the following:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14        \fs24 Results of functional performance tests.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 Disposition of deficiencies found during testing, including details of corrective measures used or proposed.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 3.\fs14\tab\fs24 Functional performance test procedures used during the commissioning process including measureable criteria for test acceptance, provided herein for repeatability.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Exception:  \b0 Deferred tests that cannot be performed at the time of report preparation due to climatic conditions.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\fs24  \fs27\par

\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C501.4 Compliance.  \b0 Alterations, repairs, additions and changes of occupancy to, or relocation of, existing buildings and structures shall comply with (i) all applicable provisions of this code, (ii) the provisions for alterations, repairs, additions and changes of occupancy or relocation, respectively, in the New York City Construction Codes, (iii) the New York City Fire Code, and (iv) the New York City Electrical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C501.6 Historic Buildings.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C501.6 - Revise Section C501.6 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C501.6 Historic Buildings. \b0 No provisions of this code relating to the construction, repair, alteration, restoration, and change of occupancy shall be mandatory for historic buildings.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section C501.7 Compliance alternative.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section C501.7 - Revise Section C501.7 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 C501.7 Compliance alternative.  \b0 Additions, alterations, repairs, and changes of occupancy are permitted to comply with the requirements of ASHRAE 90.1-2013 in lieu of compliance with the requirements of Sections C502, C503, C504 and C505, as applicable.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 Appendix CA\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Add a new Appendix CA to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 APPENDIX CA\line MODIFIED NATIONAL STANDARD FOR BUILDINGS,\line EXCEPT FOR LOW-RISE RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS\par
SECTION CA101\line SCOPE\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj CA101.1 Scope. \b0 This appendix provides the modifications to the nationally recognized standard ASHRAE 90.1, providing the minimum requirements for energy-efficient design of most buildings, except low-rise residential buildings. Where a referenced publication has been modified for the City of New York as by the New York City Energy Conservation Code, every reference to such publication shall be deemed to include all such modifications.\b\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc SECTION CA102\line ENERGY STANDARD FOR COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj CA102.1 General. \b0 Commercial buildings shall be constructed in accordance with Chapter C4 of this code or in accordance with ASHRAE 90.1, Energy Standard for Buildings Except Low-Rise Residential Buildings, 2013 edition, modi\-fied for New York City as follows. Refer to the rules of the department for any subsequent additions, modifications or deletions that may have been made to this standard in accor\-dance with Section 28-103.19 of the Administrative Code.\b\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj Section 3 - DEFINITIONS, ABBREVIATIONS, AND ACRONYMS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 3 - Revise the definition \ldblquote authority having jurisdiction\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote attic and other roofs,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li780\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ul\b\fs24 authority having jurisdiction:\b0  The commissioner or the commissioner\rquote s designee.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 3 - Revise the definition \ldblquote building official\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote building material,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ul\b\fs24 building official:\b0  The commissioner or the commissioner\rquote s designee. \ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 3 - Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote electrical design load\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote efficiency,\rdblquote  to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 electrical design load:\b0  The electrical load that feeders and branch circuits are required to support pursuant to the relevant provisions of the New York City Electrical Code for the category of equipment loads being supported.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 3 - Add a new\b  \b0 definition of \ldblquote high-efficacy lamps\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote heating seasonal performance factor (HSPF),\rdblquote  to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 high-efficacy lamps:\b0   Compact fluorescent lamps, T-8 or smaller diameter linear fluorescent lamps, or lamps with a minimum efficacy of:\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-150\li870\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14      \fs24 60 lumens per watt for lamps over 40 watts;\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li870\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-150\li870\qj\ul\fs24 2\fs14 .     \fs24 50 lumens per watt for lamps over 15 watts to 40 watts; and\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li870\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-150\li870\qj\ul\fs24 3.\fs14      \fs24 40 lumens per watt for lamps 15 watts or less.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 3 - Add a new definition of \ldblquote networked guest room control system\rdblquote  after the definition of \ldblquote nameplate rating\rdblquote  to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 networked guest room control system\b0 : a control system, accessible from the hotel/motel front desk or other central location, that is capable of identifying reserved rooms according to a timed schedule, and is capable of controlling HVAC in each hotel/motel guest room separately.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ul\b\fs24 Section 5 -  BUILDING ENVELOPE\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24   \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 5.1.3  Envelope Alterations.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 5.1.3 - Delete Item 8 under Exceptions.\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 5.4.3.4 Vestibules.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 5.4.3.4 - Revise Item 7 under Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 7.\tab Doors that open directly from a space less than 3,000 square feet in area, in buildings less than 75 feet in height, and doors that open directly from a space less than 1,000 square feet in area, in buildings 75 feet and greater in height.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 5.4.3 Air Leakage\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 5.4.3 - Add a new Section 5.4.3.5 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 5.4.3.5\b0  \b Air Barrier Testing\b0 .  New buildings of a certain size must comply with the following requirements:\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 a.\fs14\tab\fs24 New buildings 25,000 square feet and greater, but less than 50,000 square feet, and less than or equal to 75 feet in height must show compliance through testing in accordance with ASTM E 779 and department rules.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 b.\fs14\tab\fs24 New buildings 50,000 square feet and greater, shall test or inspect each type of unique air barrier joint or seam in the building envelope for continuity and defects, as per an Air Barrier Continuity Plan developed by a registered design professional.  Alternatively, new buildings 50,000 square feet and greater may show compliance through testing in accordance with ASTM E 779 and department rules.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-510\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 c.\fs14      \fs24 Rules governing air barrier testing promulgated by the department.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 5.5.3 Opaque Areas.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 5.5.3 - Add a new Item 3 under Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\ri205\sb9\qj\ul\fs24 3.\fs14\tab\fs24 When the total area of penetrations from mechanical equipment listed in Table 6.8.1-4 exceeds 1% of the opaque above-grade wall area, the mechanical equipment penetration area shall be calculated as a separate wall assembly with a default U-factor of 0.5, and compliance shall be shown with method b. W\fs27 here mechanical equipment has been tested in accordance with testing standards approved by the department, the mechanical equipment penetration area may be calculated as a separate wall assembly with the U-factor as determined by such test.\ulnone  \ul\fs24\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\ulnone  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 5.6.1.1\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 5.6.1.1 - Add a new sentence at the end of Section 5.6.1.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 When the total area of penetrations from mechanical equipment listed in Table 6.8.1-4 exceeds 1% of the opaque above-grade wall area, the mechanical equipment penetration area shall be calculated as a separate wall assembly with a default U-factor of 0.5.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul Section 5.6.1.1 - Add a new Exception to Section 5.6.1.1 to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\b Exception:\b0  Where mechanical equipment has been tested in accordance with testing standards approved by the department, the mechanical equipment penetration area may be calculated as a separate wall assembly with the U-factor as determined by such test. \par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ulnone\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ul\b\fs24 Section 6 - HEATING, VENTILATION, AND AIR-CONDITIONING\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 6.1.1.3 Alterations to Heating, Ventilating, Air Conditioning, and Refrigeration in Existing Buildings.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Section 6.1.1.3.1 - Revise Section 6.1.1.3.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 6.1.1.3.1 \b0 New HVACR equipment that are part of the alteration or a direct replacement of the existing HVACR shall comply with the applicable provisions in Section 6 to that equipment being installed.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24   \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 6.1.1.3.2 - Revise Section 6.1.1.3.2. to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 6.1.1.3.2\b0  New cooling systems installed to serve previously uncooled spaces and new heating systems installed to serve previously unheated spaces shall comply with this section as described in Section 6.2.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 6.3.2\b0   \b Criteria.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 6.3.2 - Delete Items k through r and replace them with new Items k through s to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ul\fs24 k.\tab Systems serving hotel/motel guest rooms shall comply with Section 6.4.3.3.5.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 l.\fs14\tab\fs24 Except for piping within manufacturers\rquote  units, HVAC piping shall be insulated in accordance with Tables 6.8.3-1 and 6.8.3-2. Insulation exposed to weather shall be suitable for outdoor service, e.g., protected by aluminum, sheet metal, painted canvas, or plastic cover. Cellular foam insulation shall be protected as above or painted with a coating that is water retardant and provides shielding from solar radiation.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 m.\fs14\tab\fs24 Ductwork and plenums shall be insulated in accordance with Tables 6.8.2-1 and 6.8.2-2 and shall be sealed in accordance with Section 6.4.4.2.1.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 n.\tab Construction documents shall require a ducted system to be air balanced in accordance with industry accepted procedures.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 o.\fs14\tab\fs24 Outdoor air intake and exhaust systems shall meet the requirements of Section 6.4.3.4.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 p.\fs14\tab\fs24 Where separate heating and cooling equipment serves the same temperature zone, thermostats shall be interlocked to prevent simultaneous heating and cooling.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 q.\fs14\tab\fs24 Systems with a design supply air capacity greater than 10,000 cfm shall have optimum start controls.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 r.\fs14\tab\fs24 The system shall comply with the demand control ventilation requirements in Section 6.4.3.8.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 s.\tab The system complies with the door switch requirements in Section 6.5.10.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 6.4.3.3.5  Automatic Control of HVAC in Hotel/Motel Guest Rooms.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 6.4.3.3.5 - Add a new Section 6.4.3.3.5 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 6.4.3.3.5 Automatic Control of HVAC in Hotel/Motel Guest Rooms.\b0  In hotels and motels with greater than 50 guest rooms, automatic controls for the HVAC equipment serving each guest room shall be configured according to the requirements in the following subsection. Controls must comply with either Section 6.4.3.3.5.1 or 6.4.3.3.5.2.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ul\b\fs24\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj 6.4.3.3.5.1 Guest Room HVAC Setpoint Control.\b0  Within 30 minutes of all occupants leaving the guest room, HVAC setpoints shall be automatically raised by at least 4\'b0F (2\'b0C) from the occupant setpoint in the cooling mode and automatically lowered by at least 4\'b0F (2\'b0C) from the occupant setpoint in the heating mode. When the guest room is unrented and unoccupied, HVAC setpoints shall be automatically reset to 80\'b0F (27\'b0C) or higher in the cooling mode and to 60\'b0F (16\'b0C) or lower in the heating mode. Unrented and unoccupied guest rooms shall be determined by either of the following:\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi1080\qj\ul\fs24 a.\tab The guest room has been continuously unoccupied for up to 16 hours.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 b.\tab A networked guest room control system indicates the guest room is unrented and the guest room is unoccupied for more than 30 minutes.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exceptions:\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 A networked guest room control system shall be permitted to return the thermostat setpoints to their default occupied setpoints 60 minutes prior to the time the room is scheduled to be occupied.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi1080\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 Cooling for humidity control shall be permitted during unoccupied periods.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 6.4.3.3.5.2 Automatic Control.\b0  Captive key card systems shall be permitted to be used to comply with Section 6.4.3.3.5.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 6.5.6.1  Exhaust Air Energy Recovery. \ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Section 6.5.6.1 - Revise Item 8 under the Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 8.\tab Where the largest source of air exhausted at a single location at the building exterior is less than 75 percent of the design outdoor air flow rate.  Multiple exhaust fans or outlets located within a 30 foot radius from the outdoor air supply unit shall be considered a single exhaust location.\ulnone\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ul\b\fs24 6.7.2.4  System Commissioning.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 6.7.2.4.  System Commissioning.\b0   Projects complying with this standard shall also comply with Section C408 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code in regards to system commissioning.  When demonstrating compliance with Section C408.3, projects following ASHRAE 90.1-2013 must demonstrate compliance with Section 9 of ASHRAE 90.1-2013 as required, in lieu of Section C405 of the New York City Energy Conservation Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
