\ul\b\fs24 Section 8 - POWER\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 8.4.1 Voltage Drop.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Section 8.4.1 - Delete Section 8.4.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 8.4.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 8.4.1  Voltage Drop.\b0   The conductors for feeders and branch circuits combined shall be sized for a maximum of 5% voltage drop total.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exception:  \b0 Feeder conductors and branch circuits that are dedicated to emergency services.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 8.4.5 Measurement of electrical consumption of tenant spaces in covered buildings.  \ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 8.4.5 - Add a new Section 8.4.5 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 8.4.5 Measurement of electrical consumption of tenant spaces in covered buildings.  \b0 The terms meter, submeter, covered building, tenant space and covered tenant space shall be as defined in Section 28-311.2 of the Administrative Code of the city of New York.  Each covered tenant space in a new building shall be equipped with a separate meter or sub-meter to measure the electrical consumption of such space when let or sublet. Where the covered tenant space is a floor with multiple tenancies, each tenancy with an area less than that as defined in Section 28-311.2 of the Administrative Code of the city of New York shall (i) be equipped with a separate meter or sub-meter, (ii) share a meter or sub-meter with other tenant spaces on the floor, or (iii) share a meter or sub-meter covering the entire floor.  As new covered tenant spaces are created, they shall be equipped with meters or sub-meters as provided in this section.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exception:\b0  Covered tenant space for which the electrical consumption within such space is measured by a meter dedicated exclusively to that space.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section 9 - LIGHTING\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 9.1.1 Scope.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 9.1.1 - Delete Item 2 under Exceptions and replace with a new Item 2 under Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 2.\tab Dwelling units within commercial buildings shall not be required to comply with this section provided that not less than 75 percent of the permanently installed fixtures, other than low-voltage lighting, shall be fitted for, and contain only, high efficacy lamps.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 9.1.2  Lighting Alterations.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Section 9.1.2 - Delete Section 9.1.2 in its entirety and replace with a new Section 9.1.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 9.1.2 Lighting Alterations.  \b0 For the alteration of any lighting system in an interior space, that space shall comply with the lighting power density (LPD) requirements of Section 9.2.2.3 and the control requirements of Section 9.4.1.1, as applicable to that space.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 For the alteration of any lighting system in an exterior building application, that lighting system shall comply with the lighting power density (LPD) requirements of Section 9 applicable to the area illuminated by that lighting system and the applicable control requirements of Sections 9.4.2 and 9.4.1.4.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\li870\qj\fs22\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-150\li870\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exception(s):\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1950\qj\ul\fs24\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Alterations that involve 20% or less of the connected lighting load in a space or area need not comply with these requirements, provided that such alterations do not increase the installed LPD.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1950\qj\ul\fs24\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 Routine maintenance or repair situations.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 9.4.1.1 Interior lighting controls. \ulnone\b0\par
\par
\ul Section 9.4.1.1 - Delete Item h in its entirety and replace with a new Item h to read as follows:\par
\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj h.  Automatic full OFF: All lighting shall be automatically shut off within 20 minutes of all occupants leaving the space. A control device meeting this requirement shall control no more than 5000 ft\super 2\nosupersub ,\super  \nosupersub provided that for open plan offices, a control device meeting this requirement shall control no more than 2500 ft\super 2\nosupersub .\par
\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\b Exceptions:\b0  The following lighting is not required to be automatically shut off:\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\ul\fs24 1.   General lighting and task lighting in shop, laboratory, and preschool classrooms.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 General lighting and task lighting in spaces where automatic shutoff would endanger the safety or security of room or building occupants.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\ul\fs24 3.\fs14      \fs24 Lighting required for 24/7 operation.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\ul\fs24 4.\fs14\tab\fs24 Lighting in offices smaller than 200 square feet in area equipped with lighting controls activated by photosensor.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 9.4.3 Functional Testing.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 9.4.3 - Renumber Section 9.4.3, Functional Testing, as Section 9.4.4 .\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 9.4.3 Exit Signs.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section 9.4.3 - Add a new Section 9.4.3 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\ul\b\fs24 9.4.3 Exit Signs.\b0   Internally illuminated exit signs shall not exceed 5 W per face.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\cf1\ul\fs13 1.\fs14  \fs13  In cases where both a common space type and a building area specific space type are listed, the building area specific space type shall apply.\fs27\par
\fs13 2.\fs14   \fs13 In corridors, the extra lighting power density allowance is permitted when the width of the corridor is less than 8 ft and is not based on the RCR.\fs27\par
\fs13 3.\fs14   \fs13 A "Facility for the Visually Impaired" is a facility that can be documented as being designed to comply with the light levels in ANSI/IES RP-28 and is licensed or will be licensed by local/state authorities for either senior long-term care, adult daycare, senior support and/or people with special visual needs.\fs27\par
\fs13 4.\fs14  \fs13 For accent lighting, see Section 9.6.2(b).\fs27\par
\fs13 5.\fs14  \fs13 Sometimes referred to as a "Picking Area."\fs27\par
\fs13 6.\fs14  \fs13 Automatic daylight responsive controls are mandatory only if the requirements of the specified sections are present.\fs27\par
\fs13 7.\fs14  \fs13 An additional 0.53w/ft\super 2\nosupersub  shall be allowed, provided that the additional lighting is controlled separately from the base allowance of 0.42 W/ft\super 2\nosupersub . The additional 0.53 w/ft\super 2\nosupersub  allowance shall not be used for any other purpose.\fs27\par
\fs13 8.\fs14  \fs13 Occupant sensor shall not have an override switch that converts from manual-on to automatic-on functionality.\fs27\par
\fs13 9.\fs14  \fs13 The occupant sensor may have a grace period of up to 30 seconds to turn on the lighting automatically after the sensor has turned off the lighting if occupancy is detected.\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ulnone\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section 10 - OTHER EQUIPMENT \par
\par
10.4.4 Escalators and Moving Walks.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 10.4.4 - Add a new Section 10.4.4.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 10.4.4.1 Regenerative Drive.  \b0 An escalator designed either for one-way down operation only or for reversible operation shall have a variable frequency regenerative drive that supplies electrical energy to the building electrical system when the escalator is loaded with passengers whose combined weight exceeds 750 pounds.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24\par
\ul\b Section 11 - ENERGY COST BUDGET METHOD \par
\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Table 11.5.1 Modeling Requirements for Calculating Design Energy Cost and Energy Cost Budget #5 Column A\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ul\fs24 Revise Item 1 under Exceptions in Table 11.5.1 #5 Column A to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\ri100\sb60\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Any envelope assembly that covers less than 5% of the total area of that assembly type (e.g., exterior walls) need not be separately described. If not separately described, the area of an envelope assembly must be added to the area of the adjacent assembly of that same type.  When the total area of penetrations from  mechanical equipment listed in Table 6.8.1-4 exceeds 1% of the opaque above-grade wall area, the mechanical equipment penetration area shall be calculated as a separate wall assembly with a default U-factor of 0.5. \fs27 Where mechanical equipment has been tested in accordance with testing standards approved by the department, the mechanical equipment penetration area may be calculated as a separate wall assembly with the U-factor as determined by such test. \fs24\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\ri100\sb60\qj\ulnone\fs27\par

\ul\b Appendix G - PERFORMANCE RATING METHOD\ulnone\b0  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24\par
Table G3.1\cf0\b0\f5\fs22  \cf1\b\f0\fs24 Modeling Requirements for Calculating Proposed and Baseline Building Performance #5 Column A\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ul\fs24 Revise Exception 1 under Table G.3.1 #5 Column A to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li870\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 All uninsulated  assemblies  (e.g.,  projecting  balconies, perimeter edges of intermediate floor slabs, concrete floor beams over parking garages, roof parapet) shall be separately modeled using either of the following techniques:\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1080\qj\ul\fs24 a.\fs14\tab\fs24 Separate model of each of these assemblies within the energy simulation model.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs24 b.\tab Separate calculation of the U-factor for each of these assemblies. The U-factors of these assemblies are then averaged with larger adjacent surfaces using an area- weighted average method. This average U-factor is modeled within the energy simulation model.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\fs24 Any other envelope assembly that covers less than 5% of the total area of that assembly type (e.g., exterior walls) need not be separately described, provided that it is similar to an assembly being modeled. If not separately described, the area of an envelope assembly shall be added to the area of an assembly of that same type with the same orientation and thermal properties.  When the total area of penetrations from mechanical equipment listed in Table 6.8.1-4 exceeds 1% of the opaque above-grade wall area, the mechanical equipment penetration area shall be calculated as a separate wall assembly with a default U-factor of 0.5. \fs27 Where mechanical equipment has been tested in accordance with testing standards approved by the department, the mechanical equipment penetration area may be calculated as a separate wall assembly with the U-factor as determined by such test.\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\b\fs24\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li540\qj\ul\fs18 a.\fs14\tab\fs18 R-values are minimums. U-factors and SHGC are maximums. When insulation is installed in a cavity which is less than the label or design thickness of the insulation, the installed R-value of the insulation shall not be less than the R-value specified in the table.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 b.\fs14\tab\fs18 The fenestration U-factor column excludes skylights. The SHGC column applies to all glazed fenestration. Exception: Skylights may be excluded from glazed fenestration SHGC requirements in climate zones 1 through 3 where the SHGC for such skylights does not exceed 0.30.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 c.\fs14\tab\fs18\ldblquote 15/19\rdblquote  means R-15 continuous insulation on the interior or exterior of the home or R-19 cavity insulation at the interior of the basement wall. \ldblquote 5/13\rdblquote  shall be permitted to be met with R-13 cavity insulation on the interior of the basement wall plus R-5 continuous insulation on the interior or exterior of the home. \ldblquote 10/13\rdblquote  means R-10 continuous insulation on the interior or exterior of the home or R-13 cavity insulation at the interior of the basement wall.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 d.\fs14\tab\fs18 R-5 shall be added to the required slab edge R-values for heated slabs. Insulation depth shall be the depth of the footing or 2 feet, whichever is less in Climate Zones 1 through 3 for heated slabs.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 e.\fs14\tab\fs18 There are no SHGC requirements in the Marine Zone.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 f.\fs14\tab\fs18 Basement wall insulation is not required in warm-humid locations as defined by Figure R301.1 and Table R301.1.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 g.\fs14\tab\fs18 Or insulation sufficient to fill the framing cavity, R-19 minimum.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 h.\fs14\tab\fs18 The first value is cavity insulation, the second value is continuous insulation, so \ldblquote 13+5\rdblquote  means R-13 cavity insulation plus R-5 continuous insulation.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li540\ul\fs18 i.\fs14\tab\fs18 The second R-value applies when more than half the insulation is on the interior of the mass wall.\ulnone\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li510\qj\cf1\ul\fs18 a.\fs14\tab\fs18 Nonfenestration U-factors shall be obtained from measurement, calculation or an approved source.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 b.\fs14\tab\fs18 When more than half the insulation is on the interior, the mass wall U-factors shall be a maximum of 0.17 in Climate Zone 1, 0.14 in Climate Zone 2, 0.12 in Climate Zone 3, 0.057 in Climate Zone 4 except Marine, 0.065 in Climate Zone 5 and Marine 4, and 0.057 in Climate Zones 6 through 8.\ulnone\fs27\par
\ul\fs18 c.\fs14\tab\fs18 Basement wall U-factor of 0.360 in warm-humid locations as defined by Figure R301.1 and Table R301.1.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R402.2.4 Access hatches and doors.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R402.2.4 - Revise the Exception to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 Exception\b0 :  Vertical doors that provide access from conditioned to unconditioned spaces shall be permitted to meet the fenestration requirements of Table R402.1.2 based on the applicable climate zone specified in Chapter R3.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R402.2.8 Floors.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R402.2.8 - Revise the Exception to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 Exception\b0 :  The floor framing-cavity insulation shall be permitted to be in contact with the topside of sheathing or continuous insulation installed on the bottom side of floor framing where combined with insulation that meets or exceeds the minimum wood frame wall R-value in Table R402.1.2 and that extends from the bottom to the top of all perimeter floor framing members.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R402.2.11 Crawl Space Walls.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R402.2.11 - Revise the third sentence of Section R402.2.11 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 Exposed earth in unvented crawl space foundations shall be covered with a continuous Class I vapor retarder in accordance with the New York City Building Code, as applicable.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R402.3 Fenestration (Prescriptive).\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R402.3 - Revise Section R402.3 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 R402.3 Fenestration (Prescriptive).  \b0 In addition to the requirements of Section R402, fenestration shall comply with Sections R402.3.1 through R402.3.5.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R402.4.2 Fireplaces.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R402.4.2 - Revise the second paragraph of Section R402.4.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 New wood-burning fireplaces that are designed to allow an open burn and new wood-burning fireplace units that are designed to allow an open burn shall be provided with a source of outdoor combustion air as required by the fireplace construction provisions of the New York City Building Code, as applicable.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R402.4.4 Rooms containing fuel-burning appliances.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Section R402.4.4 - Revise Item 2 under Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 Fireplaces and stoves complying with Section R402.4.2 and Chapter 9 of the New York City Mechanical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R402.5 Maximum fenestration U-factor and SHGC (Mandatory).\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R402.5 - Revise Section R402.5 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 R402.5 Maximum fenestration U-factor and SHGC (Mandatory). \b0 The area-weighted average maximum fenestration U-factor permitted using tradeoffs from Section R402.1.5 or R405 shall be 0.40 for vertical fenestration, and 0.75 for skylights.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\b\fs24 Section R403.3.2 Sealing (Mandatory).\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R403.3.2 - Revise Section R403.3.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 R403.3.2 Sealing (Mandatory). \b0 Ducts, air handlers and filter boxes shall be sealed. Joints and seams shall comply with the New York City Mechanical Code, as applicable.\par
\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li720\qj\ul\b Exceptions:\par
\ulnone\b0\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li1440\qj\ul\fs24 1.\fs14\tab\fs24 Air-impermeable spray foam products shall be permitted to be applied without additional joint seals.\par
\par
2.\fs14\tab\fs24 For ducts having a static pressure classification of less than 2 inches of water column (500 Pa), additional closure systems shall not be required for continuously welded joints and seams, and locking-type joints and seams of other than the snap-lock and button-lock types. \ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R403.6 Mechanical Ventilation (Mandatory).\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R403.6 - Revise the first sentence of Section R403.6 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\fs24 The building shall be provided with ventilation that meets the requirements of the New York City Mechanical Code, as applicable, or with other approved means of ventilation.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R403.8  Systems serving multiple dwelling units (Mandatory).\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R403.8 - Revise Section R403.8 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 R403.8 \f1 Systems serving multiple dwelling units (Mandatory)\f0 .  \b0 Systems serving multiple dwelling units shall comply with Sections C403 and C404 of this code in lieu of Section R403.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 SECTION R404\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 ELECTRICAL POWER AND LIGHTING SYSTEMS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R404.2 Electrical energy consumption.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R404.2 - Add a new Section R404.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 R404.2 Electrical energy consumption (Mandatory).  \b0 In all buildings having individual dwelling units, provisions shall be made to determine the electrical energy consumed by each unit by separately metering individual dwelling units.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION R406\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 ENERGY RATING INDEX\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 COMPLIANCE ALTERNATIVE\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R406.2 Mandatory requirements.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R406.2 Mandatory requirements - Revise the second sentence of Section R406.2 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\fs24 The building thermal envelope shall be greater than or equal to levels of efficiency and Solar Heat Gain Coefficient in Table 402.1.1 or 402.1.3 of the 2011 New York City Energy Conservation Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 CHAPTER R5\line EXISTING BUILDINGS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION R501\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 GENERAL\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R501.4 Compliance.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R501.4 - Delete Section R501.4 in its entirety and replace with a new Section R501.4 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 R501.4 Compliance.  \b0 Alterations, repairs, additions and changes of occupancy to, or relocation of, existing buildings and structures shall comply with (i) all applicable provisions of this code, (ii) the provisions for alterations, repairs, additions and changes of occupancy or relocation, respectively, in the New York City Construction Codes, (iii) the New York City Fire Code, and (iv) the New York City Electrical Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R501.6 Historic Buildings.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R501.6 - Revise Section R501.6 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 R501.6 Historic Buildings.  \b0 No provisions of this code relating to the construction, repair, alteration, restoration, and change of occupancy shall be mandatory for historic buildings.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION R502\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 ADDITIONS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R502.1.1.1 Building Envelope.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R502.1.1.1 - Revise the Exception under Section R502.1.1.1 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 Exception\b0 : Where nonconditioned space is changed to conditioned space, the building envelope of the addition shall comply where the UA, as determined in Section R402.1.5, of the existing building and the addition, and any alterations that are part of the project, is less than or equal to UA generated for the existing building.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 SECTION R503\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 ALTERATIONS\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R503.1.1 Building Envelope.\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R503.1.1 - Delete Section R503.1.1 in its entirety and replace with a new Section R503.1.1 to read as follows:\fs27\par
\ulnone\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 R503.1.1 Building envelope.  \b0 Building envelope assemblies that are part of the alteration shall comply with Section R402.1.2 or R402.1.4, Sections R402.2.1 through R402.2.13, R402.3.1, R402.3.2, R402.4.3 and R402.4.5.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section R503.1.4 Lighting\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section R503.1.4 - Revise the Exception under Section R503.1.4 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\ul\b\fs24 Exception:\b0  Alterations that replace less than 20 percent of the luminaires in a space, provided that such alterations do not increase the installed interior lighting power.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\fs24  \fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li-300\ri330\qc\ul\b\f3\fs24 CHAPTER R6\line REFERENCED STANDARDS\ulnone\b0\f0\fs20\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li-300\ri330\qj\f3\fs24  \f0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\ri330\qj\ul\f3\fs22 This chapter lists the standards that are referenced in various sections of the residential provisions of this code. The standards are listed herein by the promulgating agency of the standard, the standard identification, the effective date and title, and the section or sections of this document that reference the standard. The application of the referenced standards shall be as specified in Section 106. Refer to the rules of the department for any subsequent additions, modifications or deletions that may have been made to the referenced standards set forth herein in accordance with Section 28-103.19 of the Administrative Code.\ulnone\f0\fs27\par

\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qc\ul\b\fs24 APPENDIX RB\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 SOLAR-READY PROVISIONS- DETATCHED ONE- AND TWO-FAMILY DWELLINGS, MULTIPLE SINGLE-FAMILY DWELLINGS (TOWNHOUSES)\ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\ul\fs24 Appendix RB - Revise the first sentence in Appendix RB to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li510\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\ul\fs24 (The provisions contained in this appendix are mandatory.)\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section RB103.1 General. \ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section RB103.1 - Revise Item 2 under the Exceptions to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi-360\li720\qj\ul\fs24 2.\fs14\tab\fs24 A building with a solar-ready zone that is shaded for more than 50 percent of daylight hours annually.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\b\fs24 Section RB103.3\b0  \b Solar-ready zone area. \ulnone\b0\fs27\par
\fs24  \fs27\par
\ul\fs24 Section RB103.3 - Revise Section RB103.3 to read as follows:\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi360\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\li360\qj\ul\b\fs24 RB103.3 Solar-ready zone area. \b0 The total solar-ready zone area shall be not less than 200 square feet (18.5 m\super 2\nosupersub ) exclusive of mandatory access or set back areas as required by the New York City Fire Code. New multiple single-family dwellings (townhouses) three stories or less in height above grade plane and with a total floor area less than or equal to 2,000 square feet (185.8 m\super 2\nosupersub ) per dwelling shall have a solar-ready zone area of not less than 100 square feet (9.32 m\super 2\nosupersub ). The solar-ready zone shall be composed of areas not less than 5 feet (1524 mm) in width and not less than 80 square feet (7.44 m\super 2\nosupersub ) exclusive of access or set back areas as required by the New York City Fire Code.\ulnone\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\fs24  \fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\fs24\'a7 4.  Section 28-1001.3 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 85 for the year 2009, is amended to read as follows:\fs27\par
\pard\cbpat4\ltrpar\qj\b\fs24\'a728-1001.3.1 Periodic update.\b0  The commissioner shall submit to the city council proposed amendments that he or she determines should be made to this code to bring it up to date with or exceed the latest edition of the energy conservation construction code of New York state. The commissioner shall, at a minimum, submit such proposed amendments (i) following any revision of the energy conservation construction code of New York state that establishes more stringent requirements than those imposed by this code and (ii) no later than the end of the third year after the effective date of this section and every third year thereafter. Prior to such submission, such proposed amendments shall be submitted to an advisory committee established by the commissioner pursuant to section [28-1003.2] \ul 28-1001.3.2\ulnone  for review and comment.\fs27\par
\pard\ltrpar\cf0\fs22\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\cf1\fs24\'a7 5.  This local law takes effect October 3, 2016, and applies to applications filed on and after such effective date except that the commissioner of buildings may promulgate rules or take other actions for the implementation of such provisions prior to such effective date.\cf0\fs22\par
